knimeNode.name: add heat to Tree
knimeNode.shortDescription: Modifies a phylogenetic tree by application of pairwise data to the tree branches, thereby placing colours on regions with the data of interest.

fullDescription.intro: This modifies the input tree configured to include heat: a numeric value translated via a colour gradient to colour the branches of the tree. Optionally, branch widths may be set by the number of valid pairwise datapoints for taxa below the branch in the tree.
fullDescription.option: The tree to apply heat to. Ths node always creates a new tree: the input is not modified in any way
The tree, after decoration with your data, is saved to this location. Always PhyloXML format

ports.inPort: Input table including (optional) species and domain architecture information.
ports.outPort: What happened during application of heat: which taxa were used?
